Brands Seeking Micro-Influencers in 2025

In 2025, brands are prioritizing micro-influencers (1K–50K followers) for their 3–6% engagement rates, driving 70% of influencer marketing budgets. This guide highlights 15 brands actively seeking micro-influencers and how Newcollab helps you land deals worth $100–$2,000.

Why Brands Seek Micro-Influencers

Key advantages:

  • High Engagement: 3–6% vs. 1–2% for macro-influencers.
  • Cost-Effective: Deals cost $100–$2,000, with 7:1 ROI.
  • Niche Reach: Targeted audiences in beauty, fitness, or pets.

Join Newcollab to access these brands.

Top Brands Seeking Micro-Influencers

Here are the leading brands actively seeking micro-influencers in 2025:

Fabletics seeks fitness micro-influencers for activewear campaigns.

  • Niche: Fitness, fashion.
  • Campaigns: Workout Reels (~$200–$800).
  • How to Apply: Tag @fabletics #FableticsAmbassador and apply via their site.

3. Blue Apron (Food)

Blue Apron collaborates with food creators.

  • Niche: Food, lifestyle.
  • Campaigns: Recipe Reels (~$100–$500).

4. Warby Parker (Eyewear)

Warby Parker seeks lifestyle influencers.

  • Niche: Fashion, eyewear.
  • Campaigns: Try-on posts (~$200–$700).
  • How to Apply: Use #WarbyHomeTryOn and apply via their portal.

5. Pura Vida (Jewelry)

Pura Vida works with lifestyle creators.

  • Niche: Accessories, lifestyle.
  • Campaigns: Jewelry posts (~$100–$500).
  • How to Apply: Tag @puravidabracelets #PuraVida and DM their team.

faq.question: Which brands are looking for micro-influencers in 2025?
faq.answer: Brands like Fabletics, Curology, Blue Apron, Warby Parker, Pura Vida, Glossier, Gymshark, HelloFresh, Mejuri, BarkBox, ASOS, La Croix, Chewy, Shopify, and Dunkin' are actively seeking micro-influencers with 1K–50K followers for authentic partnerships.

faq.question: How much do micro-influencers earn per brand deal?
faq.answer: Micro-influencers typically earn $100–$2,000 per brand deal, depending on their follower count, engagement rate, and the scope of the campaign. Rates often range from $10–$50 per 1K followers.

faq.question: How do I pitch brands as a micro-influencer?
faq.answer: Create a professional media kit showcasing your metrics, personalize your pitches to each brand, highlight your engagement rate and audience demographics, and use platforms like Newcollab that connect you directly with brands seeking micro-influencer collaborations.

faq.question: What makes a micro-influencer attractive to brands?
faq.answer: Brands value micro-influencers for their high engagement rates (3–6%), authentic content, niche audiences, cost-effectiveness, and strong relationships with their followers. Micro-influencers often have more trusted and engaged audiences than larger influencers.

faq.question: Do I need a large following to work with brands?
faq.answer: No! Many brands specifically seek micro-influencers with 1K–50K followers because they have higher engagement rates and more authentic relationships with their audiences. Quality of engagement matters more than follower count.
